titleStmt.title: Sebastian C. Vick to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG12034

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.collection: 37th - 76th Regiments Enrolled Militia Primary Source Documents (1861-1866)
msIdentifier.idno: Box 81, Folder 71st Regiemnt 1863-1865 Col. Vick's Correspondences

body.p:
Greenville, Ky,
June the 22n\ond 1865
Thos, E, Bramlete
Gofvor of Kentuckey
Sir
I Have the Honor of droping you a Short address

Sir I wish to know why, Gen, D, W, Lindsey will not pay the Soldiers that was under my comd while we was on duty I was compell,d, to furnish my Soldiers their Rations,, at my own Expence,, I all So had to furnish my mens forage for their Horses all of which I Have paid for Except Some five or Six Hundred dollars I Have paid for all the Horses that was musterd into the Servis of my company Except four,, Said Horses was valued and musterd Into the Servis and Rece,d, By Gen, D, W, Lindsey and orderd to actiff duty By Gen D, W, Lindsey on the 5th day of Sept 1864

) See,, mustein Roll (
I Have wroat to Gen Lindsey Several times, Lately to which He gives no answer what Ever,, If my men ar Entitel,d, to pay I Hope you will Informe me our term of Servis Expired on the 5" day of March,, I Have asked Gen Lindsey to allow my Soldiers to Be muster,d, out and discharg,d, as other Soldiers
all of which He treates with Silent contempt or with Indiferent disrespect I Hope Govornor I will Hear from you, Soon, as I ver much neede the money I Have furnish,d, my men
Believe me to Bee with High Respect your obedt Servant

Sebastian, C,, Vick
Col 71st Regt E M 1st Bal Southern Kentucky Bramlett guards

Greenville Ky
June 22nd 1865
Vick Sebastian C
Col 71st Regt E. M. 1st Bat southern Ky Bramlitte Guards
To the Gov

Wishes to Know why the soldiers that were under his Control are not paid, says he furnished his soldiers with rations at his own expense also Forage for thirer horses which he has paid for except some five or six Hundred dollars, says he paid for all the horses except four &c Says he asked Gen Lindsey to allow his troops to be mustered all of Which he treated with Silent Contempt or indifferent disrespect &c
Respectfully referred to Maj W. H. Hays Insp Genl

D. W. Lindsey
Adjt Gen Ky
